title: How Silicon Valley lured ‘tech-savvy’ Cummins to US league
body:
Pat Cummins became Cricket Australia’s first $3 million player last year, and earned another $3.67 million at this year’s IPL, but money had nothing to do with him joining the San Francisco Unicorns in America’s fledgling Major League Cricket competition.

Australia’s Test and one-day captain was planning some time at home but has instead jumped at the opportunity to build relationships with some of America’s most successful entrepreneurs in nearby Silicon Valley.

The most an MCL player can earn is about $300,000 for seven regular games and, potentially, two finals. Cummins earned more than $216,000 a match in the IPL.

The lead investors in the San Francisco team, Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan, friends from Chennai who completed computer science PhDs at Stanford University and have become successful entrepreneurs, initiated the chase for Cummins.

“Of course we’re huge fans of Pat Cummins and really wanted him to join the team,” Rajaraman told this masthead. “But what really helps us out is how sort of tech-savvy and forward-thinking Pat Cummins is.

“He was thinking of his career beyond cricket, and he’s thinking about how to do interesting things at the intersection of technology and cricket, even after his playing days are done.

“He felt it would be valuable for him to develop deep relationships with Silicon Valley. We are, fortunately, in Silicon Valley, and we can help connect that.

“All the top companies and the top venture capitals are here, and we can help him network and build the kind of knowledge that he wants about start-ups and venture capital and so on. That’s why it kind of worked out.”

Cummins’ manager, Neil Maxwell, said the player was excited about the opportunities.

“He’s a very curious bloke, and he likes to learn,” Maxwell said. “He finds that learning about these things is really interesting.

“There’s a range of people connected to this franchise, including the CEO of YouTube, CEO of Adobe. It just opens up Silicon Valley.”

Cummins, who is in the West Indies preparing for Australia’s Twenty20 World Cup match against Bangladesh on Friday morning (AEST), may be the world’s only premier fast bowler with a degree in business management.

It was a strange signing because the Unicorns are supported by Cricket Victoria, while his home state of NSW supports the Washington Freedom. The four other teams in the MLC are run by IPL franchises.

Loading

Rajaraman and Harinarayan approached Cricket Victoria chief Nick Cummins about signing the elite paceman.

Nick Cummins once worked with Pat Cummins as general manager of the Sydney Thunder, and knew it would take more than another T20 competition to clinch the deal.

“Pat was pretty clear: ‘I’m not looking for more opportunities to play cricket,’” Nick Cummins told this masthead.

“My conversation with him and Neil was more around, ‘This is so much more than cricket, thinking about your aspirations and what you want to do beyond cricket.’

“It’s a chance to connect with the tech community in Silicon Valley, connect with the greenest state in America around what he’s doing for Cricket for Climate [an environmental organisation], and I think that’s what really excited him about it.”

Sports news, results and expert commentary. Sign up for our Sport newsletter.

title: How Pat Cummins’ love for technology lured him to Major League Cricket
body:
Star Australia skipper Pat Cummins is all set to make his way to the USA for the upcoming season of the MLC (Major League Cricket). It is interesting to note that an average player in the tournament can earn up to INR 2.5 crore for seven matches and two finals, whereas Cummins earned approximately INR 1.8 crore per match in the recent season of the IPL (Indian Premier League) 2024.

For the upcoming season of the MLC, Cummins has been roped in by San Francisco Unicorns, and the lead investors in the team, Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan, came forward and revealed themselves as huge fans of the Australian skipper.

“Of course we’re huge fans of Pat Cummins and really wanted him to join the team, but what really helps us out is how sort of tech-savvy and forward-thinking Pat Cummins is. He was thinking of his career beyond cricket, and he’s thinking about how to do interesting things at the intersection of technology and cricket, even after his playing days are done,” Rajaraman told the Sydney Morning Herald.

Cummins’ signing with Unicorns was made a reality thanks to the ace pacer’s shared interest in technology. The CEO of YouTube and Adobe are both connected with San Francisco, and according to Cummins’ manager, it was a chance to learn something new for the World Cup winner.

“He’s a very curious bloke, and he likes to learn, He finds that learning about these things is really interesting. There’s a range of people connected to this franchise, including the CEO of YouTube and the CEO of Adobe. It just opens up Silicon Valley,” Cummins’ manager Neil Maxwell said.

It is worth noting that Unicorns are supported by Cricket Victoria, while Cummins’ home state of NSW supports Washington Freedom. Rajaraman and Harinarayan approached Cricket Victoria’s chief Nick Cummins regarding the signing, and Nick made it clear that Cummins does not want more opportunities to play cricket, but the signing was only possible as coming to San Francisco Unicorns opens the avenue of Silicon Valley for Pat.

title: June 19 Evening Brief: Today's top news and headlines from the cricketing world
body:
1. Watch: Ruturaj Gaikwad gives cheeky send-off to Azim Kazi during MPL 2024 match, video goes viral

Ruturaj Gaikwad, who shares a good camaraderie with Kazi, opted for an unusual celebrating, cheekily teasing the dismissed batter. (READ MORE)

2. How Pat Cummins’ love for technology lured him to Major League Cricket

Cummins’ signing with Unicorns was made a reality thanks to the ace pacer’s shared interest in technology. The CEO of YouTube and Adobe are both connected with San Francisco. (READ MORE)

3. Virat Kohli struggles against Khaleel Ahmed in net session, Kuldeep Yadav likely to be part of playing XI

India will clash with Afghanistan in their Super Eight opener in the T20 World Cup 2024 in Barbados, on June 20. (READ MORE)

4. T20 World Cup 2024: White House sends congratulatory message to USA team ahead of Super 8 matches

With their massive achievement came a congratulatory message from the White House. The USA cricket team took to X (formerly known as Twitter) and shared a clip of National Security Communications Adviser John Kirby congratulating the side. (READ MORE)

5. 'Just been working really hard on it' - Tim David reveals efforts to hone leg spin

As the tournament moves entirely to the West Indies for the Super 8s and beyond, spin is poised to become the dominant force to reckon with. (READ MORE)

6. 'Education plays an important part' - Rashid Latif slams PCB chairman over dismal T20 World Cup performance

Pakistan's dismal performance at the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 has led to immense criticism from former players and experts (READ MORE)

7. 'They've proved that they're not a small team' - Aiden Markram wary of USA challenge in Super Eight

South Africa are gearing up for the crucial Super Eight stage of the ongoing ICC T20 World Cup 2024. (READ MORE)

8. 'Plenty of people are on wrong side of 30s' - Aakash Chopra on Gautam Gambhir tackling transitions as India's potential coach

However, according to former Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra, the job will be extremely difficult for Gambhir. Chopra opined that most of the Indian players are slowly getting closer to retirement. (READ MORE)

9. 'In a few years, your career will just be your stats' - Sir Wesley Hall on modern cricket

Sir Wesley Hall, recently voiced his apprehension about this trend, suggesting that in the years to come, a player's career might be reduced to only statistics. (READ MORE)

10. PCB threatens to take legal action against fan involved in altercation with Haris Rauf

title: Cognizant: Latest News, Videos and Photos of Cognizant
body:
Major League Cricket congratulates USA on historic T20 World Cup campaign

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Jun 18, 2024, 16:12 (IST)

The USA Cricket team's successful run in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 has garnered support from Americans. Major League Cricket praised the national squad for advancing to the Super 8 stage.

Why IT majors like cognizant, Infosys, HCLTech are acquiring engineering services companies

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Jun 12, 2024, 14:13 (IST)

IT companies like cognizant and Infosys are acquiring engineering services firms to diversify revenue streams and stay ahead of competition. cognizant's recent $1.3 billion acquisition of Belcan marks a significant move in this direction.

Why are Wipro and cognizant struggling to turn their fortunes around?

THE ECONOMIC TIMES / May 28, 2024, 14:14 (IST)

During the early days of the IT industry, growth simply required a company to win new clients at regular intervals. But with the industry maturing, the stakes are much higher, and IT services firms are struggling to come up with a playbook to deal with challenges

Major League Cricket granted List-A status by ICC ahead of second season

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / May 28, 2024, 10:59 (IST)

The International Cricket Council has granted List-A status to Major League Cricket (MLC), marking its second season starting on July 5, 2024. This recognition solidifies MLC's position as America's premier domestic T20 tournament, ensures official career statistics, and boosts domestic cricket talent development by recognizing local players and emerging stars.

Court takes cognizance of ED chargesheet against builder Tekchandani

TNN / May 31, 2024, 22:43 (IST)

The special court took cognizance of the chargesheet filed by the Enforcement Directorate against builder Lalit Tekchandani and 15 others individual and entities. The ED initiated a money laundering investigation based on FIRs against Tekchandani and others related to Supreme Construction & Developer Pvt Ltd.

Nomura buys 2.7% in cognizant, sparks speculation about return of activist investor

TNN / May 17, 2024, 00:43 (IST)

cognizant's stock surged on Nasdaq as speculation of an activist investor's return grows. Nomura Holdings acquired a significant stake, becoming a major shareholder. The board's resistance to granting special meeting authority reflects a defensive stance against short-term activism.

TCS, cognizant, and other IT companies implement new strategies to encourage office attendance

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / May 16, 2024, 16:06 (IST)

cognizant, TCS, Dell Technologies, Wipro, and Infosys are implementing innovative strategies to incentivize employees to return to the office post-pandemic, including roster management apps, variable pay linked to office attendance, attendance monitoring systems, and flexible work-from-home options.

Wipro to settle suit with top execs who joined rival co

TNN / May 13, 2024, 03:13 (IST)

Wipro is finalizing a settlement agreement with its former CFO Jatin Dalal and former healthcare head Mohd Haque, involving a lawsuit seeking Rs 25 crore from Dalal for breach of contract and a complaint against Haque for breaching non-compete agreements by joining cognizant.

IT majors cognizant, Capgemini hired 1.5 lakh less employees in 2023; here's why

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / May 06, 2024, 12:08 (IST)

The total number of employees hired by major IT companies cognizant and Capgemini decreased globally by 151,607 in 2023 compared to 2022, according to their regulatory filings.

What TCS, Wipro, cognizant, Dell and Infosys are doing to make employees return to the office

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / May 25, 2024, 12:00 (IST)

Tech companies are transitioning from remote work to office presence, enforcing compliance measures. cognizant and TCS link pay to office attendance. Dell uses color-coded badges, while Wipro focuses on engagement. Infosys offers work-from-home options for select departments.

cognizant to use Google Gemini for software development, internal operations

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Mar 21, 2024, 20:59 (IST)

cognizant and Google Cloud collaborate to enhance software development using AI. Ravi Kumar S invests $1 billion in generative AI. cognizant to train 70,000 employees on Gemini. Thomas Kurian highlights AI benefits. Google Cloud will support cognizant in the development of AI-led software engineering best practices, and by helping the cognizant Google Cloud AI University launch advanced courses on AI use cases.

title: The Sydney Morning Herald
body:
How Silicon Valley lured ‘tech-savvy’ Cummins to US league

After competing in the IPL and T20 World Cup, the Australian pace ace had no interest in backing up for Major League Cricket – until someone mentioned Silicon Valley.

June 19, 2024

by Malcolm Conn

‘I’ve always copped it’: Warner admits he’ll never escape shadow of sandpaper

With his international career nearing an end, David Warner will be relieved not to have to face so much abuse about his role in the 2018 Newlands ball-tampering scandal, but he also knows he’ll never fully escape the stain it left on his reputation.

June 18, 2024

by Daniel Brettig

‘Don’t stuff around with Mother Cricket’: Starc’s parting shot after Australia get England through

Mitchell Starc invoked a phrase beloved by Justin Langer to flatly reject English suspicions that Australia seriously considered easing off on Scotland to eliminate Jos Buttler’s team from the T20 World Cup.

June 16, 2024

by Daniel Brettig

Cummins reassures England a go-slow is ‘against the spirit of cricket’

Pat Cummins has dismissed suggestions Australia will try and tip England out of the Twenty20 World Cup by going easy on Scotland in Sunday morning’s match.

June 14, 2024

by Malcolm Conn

Opinion

For subscribers

Our cricketers play to win, even if it means giving the old enemy a second chance

A mischievous suggestion that Australia could manipulate results to squeeze England out of the World Cup has prompted apoplexy. It’s unlikely to happen.

June 13, 2024

by Greg Baum

‘In our interest to get England out’: Hazlewood raises prospect of tactic switch for Scotland clash

Australia have already qualified for the next stage of the T20 World Cup after thrashing Namibia, but their final group game could still decide the fate of one of their main rivals.

June 12, 2024

by Malcolm Conn

The English View

ICC Men’s World Cup

Australia have opportunity to start redeeming themselves for Ashes ‘moral failure’

Mitchell Marsh’s side should atone for unscrupulous stumping of Jonny Bairstow at Lord’s by playing their strongest XI against Scotland.

June 12, 2024

by Simon Heffer

How Australia can help the old enemy advance at T20 World Cup

Coach Andrew McDonald has deflected the possibility of rotating Australia’s squad for their last match against Scotland to force England out of the T20 World Cup.

June 11, 2024

by Malcolm Conn

Wade involved in ‘dead ball’ controversy as Australia seal big win over England

The first big heavyweight match of the Twenty20 World Cup failed to live up to the billing but there was some niggle involving the Australian wicketkeeper.

June 9, 2024

by Alan Baldwin

title: 25 domestic season: 85+ teams gather for captains, managers meeting at Sulaibiya cricket ground
body:
A full house for KCC Domestic Season 2024-25 captains and managers meeting held at Sulaibiya Cricket Ground as more than 85 teams registered with KCC

Key Highlights:

The meeting was Presided by KCC Director General (DG) Mr. Sajid Ashraf and the chief guests were Mr. Bijesh Todi & Mr. Vineet Agarwal from New Delhi, India – Co-Founders of T10 Sports & Clothing Partners of Kings XI Punjab – IPL, Seattle Orcas – Major League Cricket, USA – Saint Lucia Kings – Caribbean Premier League & USA Cricket Team).

DG Mr. Sajid Ashraf announced the much awaited official handover of the entire Sulaibiya Garden to KCC Board President Mr. Haider Farman by the relevant government authorities where the 2nd ICC approved facility will now be built (2024-25) for the hosting of international tournaments along with the state of the art high performance cricket academy in the State of Kuwait

T10 Sports announced as the only ICC & KCC approved clothing partner for broadcasted Sulaibiya Turf Tournaments in association with Dream 11 & Fancode for all KCC registered teams

More than 40 teams registered with T-10 Sports and given special discounted prices (9.5KD for a complete set of playing lower, jersey and cap of premium quality) along with Kings XI Punjab Jersey (memorabilia) signed by Shikhar Dhawan, Arshdeep Singh, Kagiso Rabada and Liam Livingstone

T10 sports announced it’s membership program with KCC where KCC registered teams and players stand a chance to win tickets to prestigious leagues like IPL, Indian Premier League, MLC (Major League Cricket, USA) and CPL, Caribbean Premier League through various membership programs.

All the 120+ representatives of KCC domestic teams who attended the meeting were given the Kuwait National Team Jersey by T-10 Sports as KCC initiates a fan engagement program like never before for it’s national men’s and women’s team

The much needed and privileged concept of teams membership and players membership program with KCC was announced by Mr. Ashraf. Only the approved teams (based on owners and sposnors background checks with all the required legal documents) along with approved players (based on employer and complete residency details and all the other required legal documents) will be allowed to participate in KCC tournaments and enter KCC premises with unique identity cards & membership number as the ICC Globle Code of Anti Corruption is implemented to counter spot fixing and potential match fixing threats in KCC domestic tournaments

A comprehensive list of domestic tournaments, membership process, registration processes, and timelines for the 2024-2025 season (August-June) was presented starting with KCC T-10 Summer League in August, powered by Al Muzaini Exchange, in the presence of Mr. Guru (Operations Manager at Al Muzaini Exchange) and Mr. Trevin (Digital Marketing Officer at Al Muzaini Exchange).

3rd umpire facility to be further enhanced in the new season with an introduction of no-ball referrals upon dismissals as and when required by match officials.

All the Senior KCC members looking after national teams, coaching, administration, operations, domestic, marketing, technical, public relations, logistics and venue management were also present in the grand domestic season meeting 2024-25 comprising of Mr. Qasim Ali (National Head Coach & Development Manager) Mr. Melwyn Serrao (Head of Domestic & Member,HPC), Mr. Naveen Jayan (Head of Match Officials & Member,HPC), Mr. Naresh Dsouza (Deputy Head of Match Officials & Technical) Mr. Robert Dsouza ( Head of Operations), Mr. Saud Qamar (Head of PR & Member, HPC) , Mr. Rishi Jayan , (Head of Marketing), Mr. Tahir Khan (Head Coach Juniors & Venue Management), Mr. Ali Talib (National Juniors Team Manager & Member,HPC), Mr. Nasser Imbran (Logistics Manager) and Mr. Harman Sahni (KCC Anchor & Commentator) along with all the KCC Match officials (umpires & scorers).

We wish all the teams and players best of luck for the upcoming season.

A follow up meeting will be lined up very soon where top 40 teams and their players will be made official members of Kuwait Cricket Club on first come first serve basis criteria and these 40 teams will play throughout the year in KCC Sulaibiya Turf Tournaments which will be Broadcasted live on Dream 11 & Fancode with a 6 camera setup including a full fledged 3rd umpire facility

ICC – International Cricket Council Asian Cricket Council Almuzaini Exchange Co Alhafiz Co T10Sports MEC Study Group Pro Sports Kuwait CricksLab Kuwait Swedish

title: Willow by Cricbuzz and the YES Network partner for major league cricket
body:
Willow by Cricbuzz, offering more live, streaming and on-demand cricket than any other sports service, and the YES Network, the nation’s pre-eminent regional sports network, announced a new deal to air seven matches featuring the defending MLC champion MI New York this upcoming Major League Cricket (MLC) season. These matches will be available on both the YES television network and the YES App, as well on Willow by Cricbuzz’s TV network and its streaming platform.

This partnership will bring the exhilarating MLC action to YES’ coverage territory of New York State, Connecticut, northeastern Pennsylvania and north and central New Jersey, starting with the Friday, July 5 season-opener pitting MI New York against the 2023 runners-up Seattle Orcas (3:30 p.m. ET).

As MI New York, led by elite West Indian batter Kieron Pollard, gears up to defend their inaugural title, YES viewers can look forward to the thrill of seven high-octane matches. These electrifying encounters will air live on YES’ television network and on the YES App, which can be accessed at www.watchyesnetwork.com. YES owns the exclusive regional media rights of the 27-time World Champion New York Yankees and the Brooklyn Nets.

YES’ MI New York Schedule

Friday, July 5 MI New York vs. Seattle Orcas 3:30 p.m. ET*

Saturday, July 6 MI New York vs. Washington Freedom 3 p.m. ET*

Friday, July 12 MI New York vs. Texas Super Kings 3 p.m. ET*

Sunday, July 14 MI New York vs. Texas Super Kings 8:30 p.m. ET

Tuesday, July 16 MI New York vs. Washington Freedom 8:30 p.m. ET

Thursday, July 18 MI New York vs. San Francisco Unicorns 8:30 p.m. ET

Sunday, July 21 MI New York vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders 8:30 p.m. ET

“The recent triumph of the U.S. cricket team over Pakistan in the ICC T20 World Cup has ignited a nationwide cricket frenzy,” stated Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz. “In a strategic move to leverage this surge in interest, Willow by Cricbuzz and the YES Network have joined forces. This alliance will not only showcase the MLC and MI New York on a grand scale but also enhance the sport’s visibility and accessibility. This transformative collaboration is poised to propel cricket’s skyrocketing popularity across the U.S. and invigorate a thriving fan base.”

“We are excited to welcome Major League Cricket and defending champion MI New York to the YES Network,” said Jon Litner, CEO, YES Network. “As sports fans around the world currently enjoy the ICC T20 World Cup, YES is delighted to partner with Willow by Cricbuzz to capitalize on the growing interest in the sport of cricket in the New York area by showcasing MI New York to sports fans throughout our territory.” YES Network
